definition: to be born/to give birth/life/to grow/raw/uncooked/student

sentences.english: Honestly, this is easier than I expected, though the frequency of archaic and rare words is quite high.
sentences.chinese: 老实说，异体字和生僻字出现的频率比我的预期高。

sentences.english: Most unusual characters can be directly entered without any problems.
sentences.chinese: 大部分生僻字符都没有直接输入，没有任何问题。

sentences.english: As far as possible colloquialism does not want awkward-sounding difficult, avoid rare word.
sentences.chinese: 尽量白话不要拗口难懂，避免生僻字。

sentences.english: In the old days, one could get away with filling in a rarely used character by hand.
sentences.chinese: 过去，人们可以通过手动填写生僻字来解决这个问题。

sentences.english: It can tell us whether or not values are missing or outlying.
sentences.chinese: 它可以告诉我们是否缺少值，或者是否存在生僻的值。

sentences.english: However, finance distress is really uncommon topic in the financial realm.
sentences.chinese: 但财务困境确是财务金融领域中相对生僻的课题。

definition: old language/the Classics/Classical Chinese as a literary model, esp. in Tang and Song prose/Classical Chinese as a school subject
new word (in textbook)/word that is unfamiliar or not yet studied/CL:組|组[zu3],個|个[ge4]
